abstract.para: Explains the basic idea, creation and settings of Anonymous forms. The name anonymous is in some cases not accurate, as the form is used for reader personal info and the readers must be authorized to edit their own info.

sect1.title: General usage of Anonymous Forms
sect1.para: Anonymous forms are similar in function and design to the Add / Edit item page. The main difference is they are placed outside of the AA Control Panel and thus do not provide the AA authorization and have a design of their own.

The most common usage is to allow web readers to suggest new content. After filling the Anonymous form it is sent to the Holding Bin and a Thank you page appears. But you can also allow readers to edit items with the Anonymous form.

sect1.title: Creating Anonymous Forms with the Wizard
sect1.para: In the previous AA versions until version 2.4, the process of creating Anonymous forms was very simple: Copy the code of the Add item page with only a few necessary changes. But as the form now allows to edit items and to use several options for it, a new wizard was created. This wizard creates the code for a complete form with the SSI include of fillform.php3 necessary to edit items. Use some feature like Show source code in your browser to get the code. The resulting form differs depending on whether Anonymous editing is allowed or not.
You may change these settings sent in anonymous fields:

table.title: Some hidden fields in the anonymous form

row.entry: The URL to which the script filler.php3 jumps when some error occurs. It may be the same page on which the form is shown.
The URL of a PHP script which receives the results from filler.php3. This allows for a completely free design of how the errors are presented to the user. See below.

sect1.para: If you are interested to know more about what the form contains, here are some remarks:

listitem.simpara: The fields shown in AA but not shown in the anonymous form are mentioned in the notshown[v7377697463682e2e2e2e2e2e2e2e2e2e] hidden variables. This is to allow to set these fields to default values on posting and to store old values on updating.

The setting use_post2shtml allows to use the POST method for the form even though it is on a shtml page. The values are stored in the database and restored by the scripts. This is very useful as the GET method allows only for a restricted capacity and shows the values in the URL.

sect1.title: Editing with anonymous forms
sect1.para: If you want to edit items with anonymous forms, first you must allow to choose which item to edit. You can create a view and add a link to the headlines, which links to the anonymous form and contains the parameter my_item_id=_#ITEM_ID_. Another approach is used in Reader management slices, see below.
You must choose the correct setting in Slice Admin - Settings - Allow anonymous editing of items, which is used by the filler.php3 script on an item update request. The options are:

row.entry: For items posted anonymously, filler always sets the ITEM_FLAG_ANONYMOUS_EDITABLE flag. By choosing this option you allow only items with this flag set to be edited.
Only items posted anonymously and not edited in AA
Similar to the previous one, but when you edit the item in the control panel, the flag is cleared and thus the item is no more allowed to be edited anonymously.

filler looks for a field of type Password (with Id beginning with password....) and requests the password sent by the user to match. The password may be set on item creation. If the field is not flagged required, an empty password may be used. The new Field Input Type, Field Insert Function and Field Validate Functions Password and Change Password provide the usual edit boxes for changing, deleting and entering password, which is stored encrypted. The disadvantage is the password must be sent on every update.

This is a special option, useful only for Reader management slices. The username given to the browser on HTTP authentification is looked for in the database. Each reader may edit only his or her personal info.

sect1.title: Reader management specifics
sect1.para: Each reader has her or his own item in the Reader management slice. Thus the HTTP authentication described above may be used directly to determine which item (reader personal details) to show in the form.

In this case two forms are needed, one being the publicly accessible subscribe form and the second being the HTTP protected Change personal details form. Because the fields on both the forms may be the same, you can use one form and include it into two different .shtml pages.

For webs not using Auth we need a way to ensure nobody not only edits but even views the data. This is achieved by assigning a special Access Code (see the Reader management documentation) to each reader, which must be added to the URL in order that the data are prefilled. The password authorization described above is than used on item update.

sect1.title: Show results
sect1.para: Sending the data to AA results in adding the data into database or in an error. Some of the errors may be excluded in advance by Javascript, which does not allow to send an errornous form. But some of them, like a username being already used, can not.

You may create your own PHP script (see an example in doc/script/show_result.php3) and send its URL as a value of a show_result variable. Add it as a parameter to the fillform.php3 SSI include created by the Wizard, e.g. <!--#include virtual="/aaa/fillform.php3?show_result=http://ecn.cz/show_result.php3&form=..."-->An array $result with the results will be sent to the PHP script and you may show appropriate messages. If you do not send show_result, the fillform.php3 script shows the standard messages. Mind the messages will appear on the place where fillform.php3 is SSI-included in your shtml page.
The $result array content is created at various places in filler.php3 as the $err[] array. Look there for accurate info. At this moment the messages are:

row.entry: Fatal error. Several messages related to the slice, not to the particular item. These errors help on creating the web page.
Array with not validated fields, field_id => message, e.g. headline........ => This username is already used created on field validation. You may create your own messages depending on the field_id.
Missing permissions. Depending on the setting for Anonymous editing (see above), this item did not fullfill the requirements.
Some error in StoreItem. Usually this points to an inner AA error.
No error. The operation was successfully done. The value is insert or update (i.e. $result["success"] == "insert" or $result["success"] == "update" in the show results script).

Added by fillform.php3 on Reader management slices: When the reader successfully confirms his or her email by using the URL sent in an email, fillform adds a message email_confirmed => OK. This message is added only when the email has not yet been confirmed.

sect1.para: Discussion: A similar result may be achieved by adding several fields to the form, e.g. fields err_page[validate][username......]="err_username.shtml" err_page[validate][*]="err_validate.shtml" err_page[*]="err_unrecognized.shtml"and by creating the .shtml pages with a static message concerning the particular error. The main advantage of this approach is the web administrator may not know PHP. The disadvantage is the necessity of creating many pages but using SSI includes the pages could look only like:<!--#include file="err_top.shtml"--> The username you entered has already been used. Please try another username. <!--#include file="err_bottom.shtml"-->
